de.polygonal.ds.SLL

type
class
implements
Collection<T>
A singly linked list.
See http://lab.polygonal.de/2007/08/13/data-structures-example-linked-lists/

Constructor

new(?maxSize : Int)
parameters
maxSize The maximum allowed size of the linked list. The default value of -1 does not impose a size constraint.

Instance Methods

append(x : T) : SLLNode<T>

Appends x to the tail of the list and returns the node storing x.

assign(x : Dynamic, ?args : Array<Dynamic>, ?limit : Int) : Void

parameters
x If x is a class reference, the linked list is filled with instances of the specified class and the args parameter is used to pass additional constructor arguments. If x is an object or a primitive value, the object reference or the value of x is assigned instead.
limit If specified, the linked list is filled with n=limit elements, otherwise the linked list is filled from head to tail. Existing elements are preserved if limit < size().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError limit out of range (if debug flag is set).
Assigns new content to the linked list by replacing elements with x.

clear() : Void

Unlinks all nodes from this list.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError copier is null: element is not of type Cloneable (if debug flag is set).
Duplicates this linked list. If assign is true the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference. If assign is false and copier is null, the method assumes that all elements implement the Cloneable interface. In this case element.clone() is used for duplicating an element. Otherwise the method uses the copier function.

concat(x : SLL<T>) : SLL<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is null or this and x point to the same list (if debug flag is set).
Concatenates this list with x by appending all elements of x to this list, This list and the specified list are not modified.

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this list contains the element x.

getNodeAt(i : Int) : SLLNode<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or list is empty (if debug flag is set).
Returns the node at 'index' i (head node equals index 0).

head() : SLLNode<T>

Returns the head of the list.

insertAfter(node : SLLNode<T>, x : T) : SLLNode<T>

returns
A reference to the inserted node storing x.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError node is null or node is not managed by this list (if debug flag is set).
Inserts x after node.

insertBefore(node : SLLNode<T>, x : T) : SLLNode<T>

returns
A reference to the inserted node storing x.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError node is null or node is not managed by this list (if debug flag is set).
Inserts x before node.

isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this list is empty.

iterator() : Iterator<T>

Iterates over all elements in this list. If performance is crucial, it's recommended to use the following loop instead: 
	  var node:SLLNode<T> = list.head();
	  while (node != null)
	  {
	    var element = node.val;
	    node = node.next;
	  }

join(x : String) : String

Converts the data in the linked list to strings, inserts x between the elements, concatenates them, and returns the resulting string.

maxSize() : Int

The maximum allowed size of the linked list. Once the maximum size is reached, adding an element to the list will fail with an error (if debug flag is set). A value of -1 indicates that the size is unbound. Always returns -1 if debug flag is not set.

merge(x : SLL<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is null or this and x point to the same list (if debug flag is set).
Merges this list with x by linking both lists together. After merging x should be discarded.

nodeOf(x : T, ?from : SLLNode<T>) : SLLNode<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError from is not managed by this list (if debug flag is set).
Searches for x in the list from head to tail starting at node from and returns the node containing x or null if x was not found. If from is null, the search is started from the head of the list.

popDown() : Void

Unlinks the tail node and prepends it to the tail.

prepend(x : T) : SLLNode<T>

Prepends x to the head of the list and returns the node storing x.

remove(node : SLLNode<T>) : SLLNode<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError node is null or node is not managed by this list or list is empty (if debug flag is set).
Removes node from the list and returns node.next;

removeHead() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError List is empty (if debug flag is set).
Removes the head of the list and returns the head's data or null if the list is empty.

removeTail() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError List is empty (if debug flag is set).
Removes the tail of the list and returns the tail's data or null if the list is empty.

reverse() : Void

Reverses the linked list in place.

shiftUp() : Void

Unlinks the head node and appends it to the tail.

shuffle(?rval : Vector<Float>) : Void

parameters
rval A list of random double values in the range between 0 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive).
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError rval is null or insufficient random values (if debug flag is set).
Shuffles the elements of this linked list using the Fisher-Yates algorithm. If rval is not given, Math.random() is used, otherwise random values are taken from the specified rval array.

size() : Int

The total number of list nodes.

sort(compare : T -> T -> Int, ?useInsertionSort : Bool) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError compare is null: Element does not implement Comparable (if debug flag is set).
Sorts the list using the merge sort algorithm. If compare is null, the method expects that all elements implement the Comparable interface.
If useInsertionSort is true, the list is sorted using the insertion sort algorithm which is faster for nearly sorted lists.

tail() : SLLNode<T>

Returns the tail of the list.

toArray(?output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
The output array or a new array if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output array from head to tail. The method creates a new array if output is not specified.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object. Prints out all elements if compiled with the -debug flag.
Example: 
	  var sll = new de.polygonal.ds.SLL();
	  for (i in 0...4) sll.append(i);
	  trace(sll); //output:

	  {SLL, size: 4}
 	  |< head
	    0
	    1
	    2
	    3
	  tail >|

toVector(?output : Vector<T>) : Vector<T>

returns
The output vector or a new vector if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output vector from head to tail. The method creates a new vector if output is not specified.
